Run fine-mapping using summary statistics

Source: R/finemapping.R
run_finemapping.Rd

Run fine-mapping with SuSiE using summary statistics for all LD blocks with prior probabilities computed by TORUS

run_finemapping(
  sumstats,
  bigSNP,
  LD_matrices,
  n,
  priortype = c("torus", "uniform"),
  L = 1,
  estimate_residual_variance = FALSE,
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

sumstats

A data frame of summary statistics

bigSNP

a bigsnpr object attached via bigsnpr::snp_attach() containing the reference genotype panel.

LD_matrices

A list of LD matrices (R, correlation matrices) for all the LD blocks in sumstats, names of the list should correspond to the 'locus' column in sumstats.

n

The sample size (optional, but strongly recommended.)

priortype

prior type: 'torus' (use the 'torus_prior' in sumstats) or 'uniform' (uniform prior).

L

Number of causal signals.

estimate_residual_variance

The default is FALSE, the residual variance is fixed to 1 or variance of y. If the in-sample LD matrix is provided, we recommend setting estimate_residual_variance = TRUE.

verbose

If TRUE, print progress, and a summary of susie_rss.

Value

A list of SuSiE results; one per LD block.

Contents

Developed by Kaixuan Luo, Alan Selewa, Xin He.
